reference.shortdesc: A citation indicates the title of a bibliographic resource.

section.title: Formatting expectations
section.p: Citations typically are usually set apart from the surrounding text by a form of highlighting, for example, italics.

section.title: Attributes
section.p: The following attributes are available on this element: and keyref.

example.title: Example
example.p: In the following code sample, the cite element is used to mark up the title of an article.
example.codeblock: The online article Specialization in the Darwin Information Typing Architecture provides a detailed explanation of how to define new topic types.
